title: Hourly to Salary Calculator
description: Convert hourly pay into annual salary using adjustable assumptions (hours/week, weeks/year).
methodSummary: Annual salary = hourly rate × hours per week × weeks worked
assumptions: If you work unpaid overtime, set hours/week to your actual average.
insights: Unpaid overtime lowers your real hourly rate → model this by increasing your hours/week.
Contractor vs Employee: Same 'annual equivalent' doesn't mean same financial outcome because pensions, PTO, insurance, and risk are often excluded.

faqs.q: Why do two people with the same hourly rate have different annual salaries?
faqs.a: Annual salary scales directly with hours worked and weeks paid. A contractor working 40 hours for 46 weeks will earn less annually than an employee paid for 52 weeks at the same hourly rate.

faqs.q: What happens to my annual salary if I work unpaid overtime?
faqs.a: Working unpaid overtime mathematically decreases your true hourly rate while keeping your annual salary fixed in the calculation.

faqs.q: Why is the default set to 52 weeks per year?
faqs.a: Salaried positions generally pay you for 52 weeks, including paid time off (PTO). If you are strictly paid only for weeks worked, you should lower the weeks metric.

faqs.q: Is a contract rate directly comparable to a salary rate?
faqs.a: No, directly converting an hourly contract rate to an annual salary is misleading because contractors lack PTO, health benefits, and pay self-employment taxes.

faqs.q: How does an annual bonus factor into this calculation?
faqs.a: This tool strictly calculates base pay from hourly wages. If you receive predictable bonuses, calculate the base annual salary here first, then add the bonus separately.
